data.title: Best workflow for AVCHD (MTS, M2TS) based cameras
data.meta_description: I recall that what worked on 64 bit Windows did not on 32 bit systems and vice versa. That is why in the AVCHD workflow write up on the wiki you have to use...
data.text:
Hi guys,

Thanks for all the effort so far.

The error posted by drKuli is exactly what I am getting as well. No video is available and the file is very small. It looks like only the audio is wrapped in the new container or something.

I also use a 32 bit version (on vista), but I have been looking in to going 64 bit as my machine already has 4 Gb.

I have a work laptop available with windows 7 64 Bit. I will test the procedure on that as well (I am sure my boss wont mind ;-))

As for the software that came with the camera. It will definitely not suffice for my editing needs. As a long term pinnacle user I expect a little bit more. The reasons I want to use Lightworks are very plain and simple:

A. I like the fact I can play with the same toys the big boys are using.

b. I like the fact that some day it will work on Linux and I can dump windows all together (video editing has still left me using windows)

c. After playing around a bit with the lightworks interface I am really starting to enjoy it.

So for now I won't delete pinnacle from my system, but hopefully with the efforts of everybody here some day soon I can..

I will get back to this forum post once I have tried conversion on the 64 bit system.

I could also shoot some sample with the 1080p setting and upload that, if you are interested. Sofar I have not used the 1080p setting as it produces lager files and I want to add the final film to blue-ray format (on DVDs, or file for my media center) anyway so there is not much point not using the AVCHD format.

@shaunthesheep

Can you tell me:

a. What the file size for the MPG-I frame files is (is it much bigger?)

b. How long it takes to transcode?

c. Do I need to keep in mind any special steps or tools in the trans-coding process?

Sorry to ask all the questions, but I have very little free time (with kids and all), so any problems I can avoid helps me be more productive.
